title: QML project
text:
1 Introduction
In this project work I tried to replicate some of the results of the paper “Hierarchical quantum circuit representations for neural architecture search”1.
In this paper the authors propose a framework named HierarQcal for representing Quantum Convolutional Neural Networks (QCNN) architectures using techniques from Neural Architectural Search (NAS). This framework enables search space design and architecture search, the former being the most challenging point in applying NAS to QCNN.
In this work we generate the family of QCNN architectures resembling reverse binary trees and we evaluate this family on the GTZAN music genre classification dataset showing that it is possible to improve model performance without increasing complexity.

title: QML project
text:
2.1 HierarQcal
HierarQcal is an open-source python package5 that simplifies the process of creating general QCNN by enabling an hierarchical design process. It makes automatic generation of QCNN circuits easy and it facilitates QCNN search space design for NAS.
The package includes primitives such as convolutions, pooling and dense layers that can be stacked together hierarchically to form complex QCNN circuit architectures.

title: References
text:
1. Lourens, M., Sinayskiy, I., Park, D. K., Blank,
C. & Petruccione, F. Hierarchical quantum circuit representations
for neural architecture search. npj Quantum Information
9, 79 (2023).


2. McClean, J. R., Boixo, S., Smelyanskiy, V. N.,
Babbush, R. & Neven, H. Barren plateaus in quantum neural network training
landscapes. Nat. Commun. 9, 1–6
(2018).


3. Pesah, A. et al. Absence of Barren Plateaus in Quantum Convolutional
Neural Networks. Phys. Rev. X 11,
041011 (2021).


4. Elsken, T., Metzen, J. H. & Hutter, F.
Neural architecture search: A survey. The Journal of Machine
Learning Research 20, 1997–2017 (2019).


5. matt-lourens. hierarqcal. GitHub (2024).
